label: EndUser
description: A single person using the application to manage personal to-do tasks on a desktop or laptop browser.
justification: Described as a single user who wants a lightweight personal task manager and interacts with tasks, categories, filters, sorting, and preferences.

label: TodoApplication
description: The local browser-based to-do list application that stores and manages tasks and user preferences on the user’s machine.
justification: Described as a browser-based to-do list app that runs locally, stores data locally, and automatically saves changes.

label: SyncEngine
description: An optional component responsible for synchronizing task data across multiple devices in an opt-in, privacy-preserving way.
justification: Future capability mentions syncing data across multiple devices while keeping privacy and local-first behavior, implying an active synchronization mechanism.

label: SuggestionEngine
description: A future analytical component that generates smart suggestions for which tasks to do next based on task attributes and past behavior.
justification: Future smart suggestions feature suggests tasks to do next based on due dates, priority, or past behavior, which implies an active recommendation mechanism.

label: Task
description: A to-do item managed by the application, with at least a title and optionally a description, due date, completion status, and other attributes.
justification: Tasks are the central items in the to-do list, created, edited, completed, deleted, filtered, sorted, and persisted.

label: Category
description: A simple list or label such as Work or Personal used to organize tasks, with its own lifecycle including creation, renaming, and deletion.
justification: The specification describes organizing tasks into simple lists or categories and managing those categories.

label: TaskListView
description: The main UI representation showing all tasks in a list that is easy to scan and interact with.
justification: The main list view is explicitly described as showing all tasks and being easy to scan and interact with, and is referenced again for layout customization and saved views.

label: FilterSettings
description: The configuration of filters applied to the task list, including completion status and category filters, which can be remembered between sessions.
justification: Filtering by completion status and category is specified, and user preferences for filters should be remembered to provide a useful default view.

label: SortSettings
description: The configuration of sort options for tasks, such as sorting by creation time, due date, or title, which can be persisted and reused.
justification: Sorting by different criteria is described, and sorting preferences should be remembered as part of the default view.

label: DefaultViewConfiguration
description: The saved combination of filters, sorting, and possibly layout that determines how the app opens in a useful default view.
justification: The app should remember preferences for filters and sorting so it opens in a useful default view, and future features reference saved views and user-defined layouts.

label: LocalTaskStore
description: The locally stored collection of tasks and related configuration that persists between browser sessions on the user’s machine.
justification: All data remains on the local machine, with local data storage and automatic saving to ensure tasks persist between sessions.

label: TaskPriority
description: A simple priority level assigned to a task, such as Low, Medium, or High, often represented with visual cues.
justification: Future wish list includes task priorities with simple priority levels and visual cues.

label: Reminder
description: A local reminder associated with a task’s due date, potentially triggering a pop-up or system notification.
justification: Future feature specifies local reminders for due dates to avoid forgetting tasks.

label: Notification
description: A local pop-up or system notification used to alert the user about reminders or due tasks.
justification: Reminders and notifications include pop-up and system notifications for due dates.

label: RecurringTask
description: A task configured to repeat automatically according to a recurrence pattern such as daily, weekly, monthly, or custom.
justification: The spec describes recurring tasks with the ability to set tasks to repeat according to patterns.

label: RecurrencePattern
description: The schedule pattern for a recurring task, such as daily, weekly, monthly, or a custom pattern.
justification: Future capability explicitly lists recurrence patterns including daily, weekly, monthly, and custom.

label: Tag
description: A label attached to tasks, in addition to categories, that supports richer organization and flexible grouping.
justification: Richer organization includes tags in addition to categories.

label: SavedView
description: A stored configuration of filters, sorting, and possibly layout that can be recalled, such as Today, This Week, or High Priority.
justification: Future feature describes saved views like Today, This Week, and High Priority.

label: TaskExportFile
description: A simple file containing exported task data used for backup or transferring tasks between machines.
justification: Data export/import feature mentions exporting tasks to a simple file format and importing them back.

label: SearchQuery
description: A free-text expression and optional filters used to search across task titles and descriptions.
justification: Search capability specifies free-text search across titles and descriptions, possibly with filters like only incomplete.

label: AnalyticsSummary
description: A collection of simple statistics about tasks, such as tasks completed per week, overdue counts, streaks, and basic chart data.
justification: Analytics/insights feature specifies simple stats like tasks completed per week, overdue counts, streaks, and basic charts.

label: SyncConfiguration
description: Settings that control opt-in multi-device synchronization and how privacy and local-first behavior are maintained.
justification: Multi-device sync is described as optional/opt-in and must keep privacy and local-first behavior, implying user-controlled sync settings.

label: SuggestionRule
description: Criteria used by the suggestion mechanism to recommend tasks, based on due dates, priority, and past behavior.
justification: Smart suggestions are based on due dates, priority, and past behavior, implying configurable or implicit rules.

label: ThemeSettings
description: User-selected appearance options including light or dark mode and customizable colors.
justification: Theming and customization include light/dark mode and customizable colors.

label: LayoutConfiguration
description: User-defined configuration for the layout of the main task view.
justification: Future feature mentions user-defined layouts for the main task view.

label: UserAccount
description: A multi-user account or login identity, explicitly not required for this single-user application.
justification: The app is for a single user with no logins or accounts, and multi-user features are explicitly out of scope.

label: AuthenticationCredential
description: Credentials such as passwords or tokens that would be used for authentication, explicitly not required in this version.
justification: Authentication is explicitly listed as not required.

label: SharedList
description: A task list shared among multiple users for collaboration, explicitly out of scope.
justification: Collaboration or shared lists are listed as not required.

label: ExternalIntegrationConfiguration
description: Settings or connections for integrating the to-do application with external services or technologies, excluded in the first version.
justification: Integration with specific external services or technologies in the first version is explicitly excluded.

label: CreateTask
description: Allow the user to create a new task with at least a title and optionally a description and due date.
justification: The specification states the user can create simple to-do items with a title, description, and optional due date.

label: EditTask
description: Allow the user to modify an existing task’s attributes such as title, description, due date, or category.
justification: Task editing is explicitly mentioned as a core capability.

label: DeleteTask
description: Allow the user to remove an existing task from the application.
justification: Deleting tasks is listed alongside editing and completion management.

label: SetTaskCompletionStatus
description: Allow the user to mark tasks as complete or incomplete and update their completion status.
justification: The user should be able to mark tasks complete or incomplete, and completion status is referenced in filtering.

label: CreateCategory
description: Allow the user to create new categories or lists for organizing tasks.
justification: The user can create categories used for organizing tasks.

label: RenameCategory
description: Allow the user to change the name of an existing category.
justification: Renaming categories is mentioned as part of basic category lifecycle.

label: DeleteCategory
description: Allow the user to delete an existing category.
justification: Deleting categories is explicitly mentioned.

label: AssignTaskToCategory
description: Allow the user to organize tasks by assigning them to categories or lists.
justification: Tasks are organized into simple lists or categories, implying assigning tasks to categories.

label: ViewTaskList
description: Display all relevant tasks in the main list view for the user to scan and interact with.
justification: Showing all tasks in a main list view that is easy to scan and interact with is a core capability.

label: FilterTasksByCompletionStatus
description: Allow the user to filter tasks in the list by completion status, such as all, only incomplete, or only completed.
justification: Filtering by completion status is one of the listed basic filtering capabilities.

label: FilterTasksByCategory
description: Allow the user to filter the visible tasks by selected category.
justification: Filtering by category is listed as part of basic filtering.

label: SortTasksByCreationTime
description: Allow the user to sort tasks in the list according to their creation time.
justification: Sorting by creation time is explicitly mentioned.

label: SortTasksByDueDate
description: Allow the user to sort tasks in the list according to their due date.
justification: Sorting by due date is explicitly mentioned.

label: SortTasksByTitle
description: Allow the user to sort tasks in the list alphabetically by their title.
justification: Sorting by title is explicitly mentioned.

label: PersistFilterSettings
description: Automatically remember the user’s chosen filter settings for use in subsequent sessions.
justification: The app should remember the user’s preferences for filters so it opens in a useful default view.

label: PersistSortSettings
description: Automatically remember the user’s chosen sorting options for use in subsequent sessions.
justification: The app should remember the user’s preferences for sorting so it opens in a useful default view.

label: ConfigureDefaultView
description: Determine and store the combination of filters and sorting that defines the user’s default view when the app opens.
justification: Remembering preferences for filters and sorting so the app opens in a useful default view implies configuring a default view.

label: AutosaveChanges
description: Save changes to tasks and preferences automatically without requiring the user to click an explicit Save button.
justification: The specification requires automatic saving and explicitly states that there should be no Save button.

label: AssignTaskPriority
description: Allow the user to set or change the priority level of a task, such as Low, Medium, or High.
justification: Task priorities with simple priority levels are described as a future feature.

label: ConfigurePriorityVisualCue
description: Display or configure visual cues corresponding to different task priority levels.
justification: Future feature mentions visual cues associated with priority levels.

label: ConfigureReminder
description: Allow the user to set up local reminders for task due dates.
justification: Local reminders for due dates are specified under future features.

label: TriggerNotification
description: Generate a pop-up or system notification when a reminder or due date condition is met.
justification: Future feature mentions pop-up or system notifications for reminders.

label: DefineRecurrencePattern
description: Allow the user to specify how often a recurring task repeats, such as daily, weekly, monthly, or custom patterns.
justification: The ability to set tasks to repeat with specified patterns is part of the recurring tasks feature.

label: ApplyRecurrenceToTask
description: Attach a recurrence pattern to a task so that new instances are generated according to the schedule.
justification: Recurring tasks imply applying recurrence patterns to specific tasks.

label: AssignTagToTask
description: Allow the user to tag tasks with one or more tags to support richer organization.
justification: Richer organization includes tags in addition to categories, implying assigning tags to tasks.

label: CreateSavedView
description: Allow the user to define and save a view configuration, such as Today, This Week, or High Priority.
justification: Saved views are mentioned as a future feature with examples like Today and This Week.

label: ExportTasksToFile
description: Export task data to a simple file format for backup or transferring between machines.
justification: Data export/import specifies exporting tasks to a simple file format.

label: ImportTasksFromFile
description: Import tasks from a previously exported file into the application.
justification: Data export/import specifies importing tasks back from a file.

label: SearchTasks
description: Perform a free-text search across task titles and descriptions, optionally with filters such as only incomplete tasks.
justification: Search feature describes free-text search across titles and descriptions with possible filters.

label: ComputeAnalyticsSummary
description: Calculate simple statistics about tasks, such as tasks completed per week, overdue counts, and completion streaks.
justification: Analytics/insights feature lists the desired statistics.

label: RenderAnalyticsCharts
description: Display basic charts that visualize the task analytics summary.
justification: The feature mentions maybe basic charts as part of analytics and insights.

label: EnableMultiDeviceSync
description: Allow the user to opt in to synchronizing data across multiple devices and configure sync options.
justification: Multi-device sync is described as optional/opt-in with privacy and local-first behavior.

label: SynchronizeDataAcrossDevices
description: Exchange and reconcile task data between multiple devices such as home and work PCs while preserving privacy and local-first principles.
justification: Sync data across multiple devices is explicitly described, along with preserving privacy and local-first behavior.

label: GenerateSmartSuggestions
description: Produce suggestions for which tasks the user should do next based on due dates, priority, and past behavior.
justification: Smart suggestions feature explicitly describes suggesting tasks based on due dates, priority, or past behavior.

label: SelectTheme
description: Allow the user to choose between light and dark modes for the application.
justification: Theming and customization include light/dark mode as options.

label: CustomizeColors
description: Allow the user to customize the colors used in the application interface.
justification: Customizable colors are explicitly mentioned under theming and customization.

label: CustomizeMainViewLayout
description: Allow the user to define or adjust the layout of the main task view.
justification: User-defined layouts for the main task view are specified as a nice-to-have feature.

label: OperateOffline
description: Run the application and perform all core operations without requiring a network connection after installation.
justification: The application must work entirely offline with no network needed after installation.
